page.title: 11Sway.
page.content: Sway has 2 garages, 2 public houses and 2 hotels. Sway Station is on the main line between London and Bournemouth, and was built in 1886. Semi-fast trains stop at Sway, and there are connections for fast trains to London via Southampton. A small industrial site of 9 units has recently been built on land beside the station. Sway Primary School, formerly St Lukes C.E. School, has moved this year to new buildings, and the school field will include a recreation area for pre-school children and 2 tennis courts to be shared with Sway Tennis Club. The Parish Council has 8 elected members and a Clerk and is responsible for allotments and recreational areas, planning applications etc. The monthly meetings are open to the public.
